memberdef.name: eig

briefdescription.para: Generalized complex-valued eigenvalue solver using LAPACK function call.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the eigenvalues(lambda) of the complex-valued generalized eigenvalue problem: Ax_r = lambda*Bx_r or x_l^T*A = lambda*x_l^T*B. The eigenvalues are returned by default. To return the right or left eigenvectors, supply the function with a std::complex<double> matrix object in the 3rd or 4th parameters, respectively.

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix< std::complex< double > > &A, matrix< std::complex< double > > *vr_return, matrix< std::complex< double > > *vl_return)
memberdef.name: eig

briefdescription.para: Complex-valued eigenvalue solver using LAPACK function call.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the eigenvalues(lambda) of the complex-valued eigenvalue problem: Ax_r = lambda*x_r or x_l^T*A = lambda*x_l^T. The eigenvalues are returned by default. To return the right or left eigenvectors, supply the function with a std::complex<double> matrix object in the 2nd or 3rd parameters, respectively.

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix< double > &A, matrix< std::complex< double >> *vr_return=NULL, matrix< std::complex< double >> *vl_return=NULL)
memberdef.name: eig

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix< std::complex< double >> &A_in, const matrix< std::complex< double >> &b_in)
memberdef.name: linsolve

briefdescription.para: Returns the size of matrix A.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the size of matrix A in a matrix_size_type variable. auto msize = size(A); int num_rows = msize.rows; int num_cols = msize.cols;
A
matrix for which you want to know the size.
A matrix_size_type variable containing the number of rows and cols.

Returns a matrix of size M x N containing all zeros.
M
Number of rows.
N

briefdescription.para: Performs array multiplication on matrices A and B.

detaileddescription.para: Each element of A is multiplied by each element of B. The matrix that is returned is the same size as A and B.

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix< T, dim > &A, const matrix< U, dim > &B)
memberdef.name: rdivide

briefdescription.para: Performs right array division on matrices A and B.

detaileddescription.para: Each element of A is divided by each element of B. The matrix that is returned is the same size as A and B. Equivalent to A./B in MATLAB.

briefdescription.para: Performs left array division on matrices B and A.

detaileddescription.para: Each element of A is divided by each element of B. The matrix that is returned is the same size as B and A. Equivalent to B. in MATLAB.

briefdescription.para: Returns the transpose of matrix A.
Returns the complex-conjugate transpose of matrix A.
Returns the complex-conjugate transpose of matrix A.
Computes the sum of each column of A.
Produces a vector containing N values logarithmically spaced between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.

detaileddescription.para:
Produces a vector containing N values logarithmically spaced between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.
x1
The base 10 logarithm of the minimum value.
x2
The base 10 logarithm of the maximum value.
N
The number of values between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2).
A vector containing N logarithmically spaced values between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.

Computes the singular value decomposition of matrix A_in.
Estimates the rank of a matrix by counting the singular values whose absolute value is greater than epsilon.

Returns true if any elements of A are nonzero.
Returns true if a is nonzero.
Returns true if all elements of A are nonzero.

Computes all roots of polynomial p by solving for the eigenvalues of the companion matrix.
Start the timer.
Stop the timer. The number of elapsed seconds is returned.
Overload of the C++ function sprintf(). This overload provides a more MATLAB-like interface. Specifically, the output is returned instead of passed by reference.
Returns a vector of integers containing the current: year, month, day, hour, minute, and second. This is based on the system clock. The number of hours is based on the 24-hour clock.

Returns the Moore-Penrose Pseudoinverse of matrix A. Currently only the SVD method is implemented. This restricts matrix A to be only square matrices. This is currently slower than inv(), use with care.
Returns a matrix containing the data read from a text file. Values must be white space separated.
Returns the standard deviation of inputed vector.
Returns the standard deviation of inputed vector.
Returns the variance (square of standard deviation) for inputed vector.
Returns the variance (square of standard deviation) for inputed vector.

Returns an N x N matrix of random doubles between 0 and 1.0.
Returns an M x N matrix of random doubles between 0 and 1.0.

briefdescription.para: Double precision eigenvalue solver using LAPACK function call.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the eigenvalues(lambda) of the eigenvalue problem: Ax_r = lambda*x_r or x_l^T*A = lambda*x_l^T. The eigenvalues are returned by default. To return the right or left eigenvectors, supply the function with a std::complex<double> matrix object in the 2nd or 3rd parameters, respectively.

briefdescription.para: The keycpp namespace prevents KeyCpp functions and classes from interfering with other C++ libraries, for instance the std library.
